afester.javafx.components

Class MultiSegment

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.Group
          • afester.javafx.components.MultiSegment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class MultiSegment
extends javafx.scene.Group
    Implements the rendering of a single multi segment display.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultiSegment

        public MultiSegment(java.lang.String displayType)
        Creates a multi segment digit.
        Parameters:
        displayType - The definition file to use. Each multi segment digit is specified by an .svg file which defines the rendering of the segments and a .chr file which defines the character set. The .svg and .chr extensions are automatically added to the given displayType.

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentMaskProperty

        public javafx.beans.property.LongProperty getCurrentMaskProperty()

      • getCurrentMask

        public long getCurrentMask()

      • setCurrentMask

        public void setCurrentMask(long value)

      • setOnColor

        public void setOnColor(javafx.scene.paint.Color col)
        Sets the color to use for enabled segments.
        Parameters:
        col - The color to use when painting enabled segments.

      • getOnColor

        public javafx.scene.paint.Color getOnColor()
        Returns:
        The color used for enabled segments.

      • setOffColor

        public void setOffColor(javafx.scene.paint.Color col)
        Sets the color to use for disabled segments.
        Parameters:
        col - The color to use when painting disabled segments.

      • getOffColor

        public javafx.scene.paint.Color getOffColor()
        Returns:
        The current color for disabled segments.

      • setPanelColor

        public void setPanelColor(javafx.scene.paint.Color col)
        Sets the panel (background) color of the segment.
        Parameters:
        col - The color to use for the background of the segment.

      • getPanelColor

        public javafx.scene.paint.Color getPanelColor()
        Returns:
        The current color used for the background of the segment.

      • setSegmentEnabled

        public void setSegmentEnabled(int idx,
                              boolean state)
        Enables or disables a particular segment. This is useful to implement a character set editor.
        Parameters:
        idx - The index of the segment, in the order defined in the segments property of the charset definition file
        state - true to enable the specified segment, false to disable it.

      • isSegmentEnabled

        public boolean isSegmentEnabled(int idx)
        Checks if the given segment is currently on or off.
        Parameters:
        idx - The index of the segment, in the order defined in the segments property of the charset definition file
        Returns:
        true if the specified segment is on, false otherwise.

      • setChar

        public void setChar(char theChar)
             throws java.io.CharConversionException
        Shows a particular character in this display digit. The mapping from the character code point to the mask of enabled segments is defined in the .chr file which was passed to the constructor. Unsupported characters will throw a CharConversionException exception.
        Parameters:
        theChar - The character to display.
        Throws:
        java.io.CharConversionException - if the character is not supported.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Turns off all segments, besides the decimal point. The decimal point is not affected by this method - to disable all segments, use clear() and setDP(false).

      • setDp

        public void setDp(boolean state)
        Enables or disabled the decimal point for this segment.
        Parameters:
        state - true to enable the decimal point, false to disable it.
